description: Each term describes the ordinal number of its position in the sequence, by a summation of the numerals in that ordinal number and then by the differences between each contiguous pair of the numerals in the order in which they appear.
example: The ordinal number 128 is represented as "1116" (11_16): where 1+2+8="11"; where the difference between 1 and 2 is "1"; and where the difference between 2 and 8 is "6". Conversely, the term "933" may represent the ordinal number 630: where "9" is the sum of 6+3+0; where "3" is the difference between 6 and 3 [6-3="3"]; and where "3" is the difference between 3 and 0.
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{id = IntegerDigits@n}, FromDigits@ Join[ IntegerDigits[ Plus @@ id], Abs[ Most@ id - Rest@ id]]]; Table[ f@n, {n, 0, 67}]
author: Daniel Mark Pech (pnpmacknam(AT)uswest.net), May 02 2000
extensions: Corrected the offset, added one term, several comments and the Mathematica coding _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 12 2009
